intro: Lysipomia laciniata subsp. linearifolia, commonly known as the linear-leaved cutleaf plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The species is characterized by its finely dissected, linear leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. This plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
